pr_title: CLDR-13197 make it easier to find more details about an error subtype

timeline.bodyText: Could we avoid adding any new jsp files? It's a legacy technology and we should be getting rid of the ones we have rather than adding new ones
timeline.author: btangmu

replies.bodyText: OK. They are easier to create for simpler pages like this- but, I will rewrite it.
replies.author: srl295

replies.bodyText: decided to not rewrite(for this PR), could be done as a followon
replies.author: srl295

timeline.bodyText: Should be https -- but I see that currently fails for cldr.unicode.org. Can the distinction be encapsulated in a single place?
timeline.author: btangmu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,28 @@
+# -*- BEGIN CheckCLDR.Subtype Mapping -*-
+# Format is URL "http..." followed by Subtype values, the latter separated by commas.
+# Each of the Subtypes is covered by documentation at that URL.
+# Comment lines must START with a #, because # is used for HTML fragments.
+
+
+
+http://cldr.unicode.org/translation/timezones#metazones

replies.bodyText:
I think for editing purposes it would be easiest to have full URLs. Doesn't look like we aren't going to get https on google sites.  Since it's plain text, I think we can do a bulk rename when/if we move to something else.
So, I would like to keep http://cldr.unicode.org for now, pending the overall discussion about moving the content somewhere else.  The goal of this ticket is to be an improvement of what we have and decouple the URLs from the source code.
replies.author: srl295

timeline.bodyText: How about "Convert this CheckStatus to JSON"?
timeline.author: btangmu

replies.bodyText: Yes, that would be a clearer name.
replies.author: macchiati

timeline.bodyText: How about a subroutine for the "for" loop?
timeline.author: btangmu

replies.bodyText: Not sure how that would help here - this function consists of several state variables, and then the loop, and then several lines of error checking which all depend on the state variables.
replies.author: srl295

timeline.bodyText: Is this a TODO for the current ticket?
timeline.author: btangmu
btangmu
btangmu

replies.bodyText: flush() is called from the JSP, so it is an administrative task.
replies.author: srl295

timeline.bodyText:
this constructor is too long to see all at once on the screen, making the logic harder to check; it could be shortened with subroutines, maybe an object containing the variables newMap ... urlCount
just a suggestion for future improvement, not a blocker for this review
timeline.author: btangmu

timeline.bodyText: here again, subroutines would be nice to avoid having to scroll up and down to see the whole method; the subroutine names could help to clarify what it's doing from a top-down perspective
timeline.author: btangmu
